p: Briefly, 3,4-dihydro-2(1 H)-pyridone synthesis employed a four-component reaction using Meldrum's acid by a heterocyclization with the corresponding β-ketoester and the corresponding aldehyde. The obtained 3,4-dihydro-2(1 H)-pyridones were treated with bromine giving the respective 6-methylbromides, which in subsequent reaction with pyridine or amine provided the target compounds 28– 38.
